pli-tv-kd22:0.3.eng: The chapter on the group of seven hundred

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vassasataparinibbute bhagavati vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū vesāliyaṃ dasa vatthūni dīpenti—
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.1.eng: One hundred years after the Buddha had attained final extinguishment, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaimed ten practices as allowable:

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.2.pli: kappati siṅgiloṇakappo, kappati dvaṅgulakappo, kappati gāmantarakappo, kappati āvāsakappo, kappati anumatikappo, kappati āciṇṇakappo, kappati amathitakappo, kappati jaḷogiṃ pātuṃ, kappati adasakaṃ nisīdanaṃ, kappati jātarūparajatanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.2.eng: the salt-in-horn practice; the two-fingerbreadths practice; the next-village practice; the many-monasteries practice; the consent practice; customary practices; the unchurned practice; palm-juice drinking; sitting mats without borders; and gold, silver, and money.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.2.comm: The meaning of these practices is not immediately obvious. They are explained further down in the text. For an explanation of the rendering “gold, silver, and money” for jātarūparajata, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vajjīsu cārikaṃ caramāno yena vesālī tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.3.eng: At that time Venerable Yasa of Kākaṇḍa was wandering in the Vajjian country, when he arrived at Vesālī.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.4.pli: Tatra sudaṃ āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.4.eng: There he stayed in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū tadahuposathe kaṃsapātiṃ udakena pūretvā majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa ṭhapetvā āgatāgate vesālike upāsake evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.5.eng: Soon afterwards, on the observance day, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī filled a bronze bowl with water and placed it in the midst of the Sangha of monks. Whenever a lay follower of Vesālī came, they said,

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.6.eng: “Please give a kahāpaṇa coin to the Sangha, or half a kahāpaṇa, or a pāda, or a māsaka.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.8.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vesālike upāsake etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.8.eng: But Yasa said to the lay followers,

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.9.pli: “māvuso, adattha saṅghassa kahāpaṇampi aḍḍhampi pādampi māsakarūpampi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.9.eng: “Don’t give a kahāpaṇa to the Sangha, or half a kahāpaṇa, or a pāda, or a māsaka.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.10.eng: Gold, silver, and money aren’t allowable for the Sakyan monastics.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.12.eng: nor receive gold, silver, or money.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.13.eng: The Sakyan monastics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.14.pli: Evampi kho vesālikā upāsakā āyasmatā yasena kākaṇḍakaputtena vuccamānā adaṃsuyeva saṅghassa kahāpaṇampi aḍḍhampi pādampi māsakarūpampi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.14.eng: But although Yasa said this, the lay followers continued to give money to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.15.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū tassā rattiyā accayena taṃ hiraññaṃ bhikkhaggena paṭivīsaṃ ṭhapetvā bhājesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.15.eng: The next morning the Vajjian monks distributed the money evenly.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.15.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “money” for hirañña, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.16.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ yasaṃ kākaṇḍakaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd22:1.1.18.pli: “Natthi me, āvuso, hiraññassa paṭivīso, nāhaṃ hiraññaṃ sādiyāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.1.18.eng: “There’s no share for me. I don’t accept money.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.1.eng: The Vajjian monks said to one another,

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.2.pli: “ayaṃ, āvuso, yaso kākaṇḍakaputto upāsake saddhe pasanne akkosati, paribhāsati, appasādaṃ karoti;
pli-tv-kd22:1.2.2.eng: “Yasa is abusing and reviling the lay followers who have faith and confidence. He’s destroying their confidence.

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.3.pli: handassa mayaṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ karomā”ti te tassa paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ akaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd22:1.2.3.eng: Let’s do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him.” And they did just that.

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vesālike vajjiputtake bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.6.eng: that a monk who has had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against him should be given a monk as a companion messenger.

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.8.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ sammannitvā āyasmato yasassa kākaṇḍakaputtassa anudūtaṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd22:1.2.8.eng: They then appointed a monk and gave him to Yasa as a companion messenger.

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vesāliṃ pavisitvā vesālike upāsake etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd22:1.2.9.eng: Yasa entered Vesālī with his companion and said to the lay followers,

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.10.pli: “ahaṃ kirāyasmante upāsake saddhe pasanne akkosāmi, paribhāsāmi, appasādaṃ karomi;
pli-tv-kd22:1.2.10.eng: “It seems that I’m abusing and reviling the venerable lay followers who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence,

pli-tv-kd22:1.2.11.pli: yohaṃ adhammaṃ adhammoti vadāmi, dhammaṃ dhammoti vadāmi, avinayaṃ avinayoti vadāmi, vinayaṃ vinayoti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.2.11.eng: in that I speak of what’s contrary to the Teaching as such and of what’s in accordance with the Teaching as such, and that I speak of what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as such and of what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as such.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.0.eng: Why monastics should not accept gold, silver, or money

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.1.pli: Ekamidaṃ, āvuso, samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.1.eng: On one occasion the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.2.pli: Tatra kho, āvuso, bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi—

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.3.pli: ‘cattārome, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.3.eng: ‘There are these four defilements of the sun and the moon that stop them from shining and radiating:

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.4.pli: Katame cattāro? Abbhaṃ, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti, na bhāsanti na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.5.pli: Mahikā, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.6.pli: Dhūmarajo, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.7.pli: Rāhu, bhikkhave, asurindo candimasūriyānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.7.eng: and an eclipse by Rāhu, the ruler of the antigods.
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.7.comm: The Pali literally says that “Rāhu, the rules of the antigods, is a defilement of the sun and the moon”, which is unintelligible without an understanding of ancient Indian mythology. See the Malalasekera’s Dictionary of Pali Proper Names for further details.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro candimasūriyānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.9.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cattārome samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.9.eng: In the same way, there are these four defilements of monastics and brahmins that stop them from shining and radiating:

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.11.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā suraṃ pivanti, merayaṃ pivanti, surāmerayapānā appaṭiviratā—

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.12.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.13.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanti, methunadhammā appaṭiviratā—

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.14.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.15.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā jātarūparajataṃ sādiyanti, jātarūparajatappaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā—

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.16.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.17.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā micchājīvena jīvitaṃ kappenti;
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.17.eng: and making a living through wrong livelihood.’

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.19.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.20.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti, na bhāsanti, na virocanti’.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.22.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā—
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.22.eng: Having said this, the Teacher added:

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.33.eng: These are called defilements by the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.38.eng: They are impure, dirty, and low.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.40.eng: Slaves to craving that leads them on,

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.43.pli: Evaṃvādī kirāhaṃ āyasmante upāsake saddhe pasanne akkosāmi, paribhāsāmi, appasādaṃ karomi;
pli-tv-kd22:1.3.43.eng: It’s by speaking like this, it seems, that I’m abusing and reviling the venerable lay followers who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence.

pli-tv-kd22:1.3.44.pli: yohaṃ adhammaṃ adhammoti vadāmi, dhammaṃ dhammoti vadāmi, avinayaṃ avinayoti vadāmi, vinayaṃ vinayoti vadāmi.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.1.pli: Ekamidaṃ, āvuso, samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.1.eng: At another time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājantepure rājaparisāyaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarakathā udapādi—
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.2.eng: the royal court was seated together in the royal compound, having the following conversation,

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.3.eng: ‘Gold, silver, and money are allowable for the Sakyan monastics;

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.5.eng: and receive gold, silver, and money.’

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.6.pli: Tena kho panāvuso, samayena maṇicūḷako gāmaṇī tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.6.eng: On that occasion the chief Maṇicūlaka was sitting in that gathering.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.7.pli: Atha kho, āvuso, maṇicūḷako gāmaṇī taṃ parisaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.9.eng: gold, silver, and money aren’t allowable for the Sakyan monastics.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.11.eng: nor receive gold, silver, or money.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.12.eng: The Sakyan monastics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.’

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.13.pli: Asakkhi kho, āvuso, maṇicūḷako gāmaṇī taṃ parisaṃ saññāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.13.eng: And he was able to persuade that gathering.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.14.pli: Atha kho, āvuso, maṇicūḷako gāmaṇī taṃ parisaṃ saññāpetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.14.eng: Soon afterwards Maṇicūlaka went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.15.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho, āvuso, maṇicūḷako gāmaṇī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.15.eng: and told him what had happened,

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.16.pli: ‘idha, bhante, rājantepure rājaparisāyaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarakathā udapādi—

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.20.pli: Evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhante, taṃ parisaṃ etadavocaṃ—

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.26.pli: Asakkhiṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, taṃ parisaṃ saññāpetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.27.pli: Kaccāhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ byākaramāno vuttavādī ceva bhagavato homi, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhāmi, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākaromi, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchatī’ti?
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.27.eng: adding, ‘Sir, have I explained in accordance with the Teaching so that I can’t be legitimately criticized or censured?’

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.28.pli: ‘Taggha tvaṃ, gāmaṇi, evaṃ byākaramāno vuttavādī ceva me hosi;

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.29.pli: na ca maṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhasi, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākarosi, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchati.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.30.pli: Na hi, gāmaṇi, kappati samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ jātarūparajataṃ;
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.30.eng: for gold, silver, and money aren’t allowable for the Sakyan monastics.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.32.eng: nor receive gold, silver, or money.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.33.eng: The Sakyan monastics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.34.pli: Yassa kho, gāmaṇi, jātarūparajataṃ kappati, pañcapi tassa kāmaguṇā kappanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.34.eng: Whoever is allowed gold, silver, or money is also allowed the pleasures of the world.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.35.pli: Yassa pañca kāmaguṇā kappanti ekaṃsenetaṃ, gāmaṇi, dhāreyyāsi—
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.35.eng: And you should know that anyone who’s allowed the pleasures of the world

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.36.eng: doesn’t have the qualities of an ascetic, the qualities of a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.37.pli: Api cāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, evaṃ vadāmi tiṇaṃ tiṇatthikena pariyesitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.37.eng: Still, I say that anyone who needs grass may look for it,

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.41.pli: Na tvevāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, kenaci pariyāyena jātarūparajataṃ sāditabbaṃ pariyesitabbanti vadāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.41.eng: But under no circumstances should they accept or look for gold, silver, or money.’

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.42.pli: Evaṃvādī kirāhaṃ āyasmante upāsake saddhe pasanne akkosāmi, paribhāsāmi, appasādaṃ karomi;
pli-tv-kd22:1.4.42.eng: It’s by speaking like this, it seems, that I’m abusing and reviling the venerable lay followers who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence.

pli-tv-kd22:1.4.43.pli: yohaṃ adhammaṃ adhammoti vadāmi, dhammaṃ dhammoti vadāmi, avinayaṃ avinayoti vadāmi, vinayaṃ vinayoti vadāmi.

pli-tv-kd22:1.5.1.pli: Ekamidaṃ, āvuso, samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ ārabbha jātarūparajataṃ paṭikkhipi, sikkhāpadañca paññapesi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.5.1.eng: On another occasion at Rājagaha the Buddha prohibited gold, silver, and money and laid down a training rule because of Venerable Upananda the Sakyan.

pli-tv-kd22:1.5.2.pli: Evaṃvādī kirāhaṃ āyasmante upāsake saddhe pasanne akkosāmi, paribhāsāmi, appasādaṃ karomi;
pli-tv-kd22:1.5.2.eng: It’s by speaking like this, it seems, that I’m abusing and reviling the venerable lay followers who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence,

pli-tv-kd22:1.5.3.pli: yohaṃ adhammaṃ adhammoti vadāmi, dhammaṃ dhammoti vadāmi, avinayaṃ avinayoti vadāmi, vinayaṃ vinayoti vadāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.5.3.eng: in that I speak of what’s contrary to the Teaching as such and of what’s in accordance with the Teaching as such, and that I speak of what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as such and of what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as such.

pli-tv-kd22:1.6.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, vesālikā upāsakā āyasmantaṃ yasaṃ kākaṇḍakaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd22:1.6.1.eng: And the lay followers of Vesālī said to Yasa,

pli-tv-kd22:1.6.2.pli: “ekova, bhante, ayyo yaso kākaṇḍakaputto samaṇo sakyaputtiyo.

pli-tv-kd22:1.6.4.pli: Vasatu, bhante, ayyo yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vesāliyaṃ.

pli-tv-kd22:1.6.5.pli: Mayaṃ ayyassa yasassa kākaṇḍakaputtassa ussukkaṃ karissāma cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānan”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.6.5.eng: We’ll do our best to provide you with robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.6.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vesālike upāsake saññāpetvā anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ārāmaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.6.6.eng: Having persuaded the lay followers of Vesālī, Yasa returned to the monastery together with his companion messenger.

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.1.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū anudūtaṃ bhikkhuṃ pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Vajjian monks asked the monk who had been the companion messenger,

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.2.eng: “Did Yasa ask forgiveness of the lay followers?”

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.3.eng: “The lay followers have acted badly toward us.

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.4.pli: Ekova yaso kākaṇḍakaputto samaṇo sakyaputtiyo kato.
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.4.eng: They now regard Yasa as the only Sakyan monastic,

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.5.comm: See CPD, sub-point 3g, for this use of kata.

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.7.pli: “ayaṃ, āvuso, yaso kākaṇḍakaputto amhehi asammato gihīnaṃ pakāsesi;
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.7.eng: “Yasa has informed the householders without our approval.

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.8.eng: Let’s do a legal procedure of ejection against him.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.9.eng: But when they gathered together to do the procedure against him,

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.10.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā kosambiyaṃ paccuṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.10.eng: Yasa rose up into the air and landed at Kosambī.

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.11.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto pāveyyakānañca avantidakkhiṇāpathakānañca bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.11.1.eng: Yasa then sent a message to the monks at Pāvā and to the monks in Avantī in the southern region:

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.13.eng: Let’s take on this legal issue—

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.14.eng: before what’s contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.15.eng: before what’s contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.16.pli: pure adhammavādino balavanto honti, dhammavādino dubbalā honti;
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.16.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;

pli-tv-kd22:1.7.17.pli: avinayavādino balavanto honti, vinayavādino dubbalā hontī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.17.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī ahogaṅge pabbate paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.1.eng: Yasa then traveled to Venerable Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī who was staying on the Ahogaṅga mountain.

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto yena ahogaṅgo pabbato, yenāyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sambhūtaṃ sāṇavāsiṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto āyasmantaṃ sambhūtaṃ sāṇavāsiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.4.pli: “ime, bhante, vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū vesāliyaṃ dasa vatthūni dīpenti—
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.4.eng: “Sir, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaim these ten practices as allowable:

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.5.pli: kappati siṅgiloṇakappo, kappati dvaṅgulakappo, kappati gāmantarakappo, kappati āvāsakappo, kappati anumatikappo, kappati āciṇṇakappo, kappati amathitakappo, kappati jaḷogiṃ pātuṃ, kappati adasakaṃ nisīdanaṃ, kappati jātarūparajatanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.5.eng: the salt-in-horn practice; the two-fingerbreadths practice; the next-village practice; the many-monasteries practice; the consent practice; customary practices; the unchurned practice; palm-juice drinking; sitting mats without borders; and gold, silver, and money.

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.6.pli: Handa mayaṃ, bhante, imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ādiyissāma.
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.6.eng: Let’s take on this legal issue—

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.7.eng: before what’s contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.8.eng: before what’s contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.9.pli: pure adhammavādino balavanto honti, dhammavādino dubbalā honti;
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.9.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.10.pli: avinayavādino balavanto honti, vinayavādino dubbalā hontī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.10.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.11.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī āyasmato yasassa kākaṇḍakaputtassa paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.12.eng: Soon afterwards, sixty monks from Pāvā—

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.13.pli: sabbe āraññikā, sabbe piṇḍapātikā, sabbe paṃsukūlikā, sabbe tecīvarikā, sabbeva arahanto—
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.13.eng: all of them wilderness dwellers, almsfood-only eaters, rag-robe wearers, three-robe owners, and perfected—

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.15.eng: And eighty-eight monks from Avantī in the southern region—

pli-tv-kd22:1.8.16.pli: appekacce āraññikā, appekacce piṇḍapātikā, appekacce paṃsukūlikā, appekacce tecīvarikā, sabbeva arahanto—
pli-tv-kd22:1.8.16.eng: some of them wilderness dwellers, some almsfood-only eaters, some rag-robe wearers, some three-robe owners, but all perfected—

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.1.pli: Atha kho therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ mantayamānānaṃ etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.1.eng: Then, as the senior monks were consulting one another, it occurred to them,

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.2.eng: “This legal issue is going to be contentious and difficult.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.3.pli: kaṃ nu kho mayaṃ pakkhaṃ labheyyāma, yena mayaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe balavantatarā assāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.3.eng: How can we get supporters to strengthen our side?”

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā revato soreyye paṭivasati—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.4.eng: At this time Venerable Revata was staying at Soreyya.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.5.pli: bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.5.eng: He was learned and a master of the tradition; he was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.8.pli: bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.9.pli: Sace mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ revataṃ pakkhaṃ labhissāma, evaṃ mayaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe balavantatarā assāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.9.eng: and said, “If we get Revata to support us, we’ll be stronger.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.10.eng: When Revata heard this conversation between the senior monks

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.14.eng: “This legal issue is going to be contentious and difficult.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.15.pli: Na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ yohaṃ evarūpe adhikaraṇe osakkeyyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.15.eng: It wouldn’t be appropriate for me to stay away from it.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.16.pli: Idāni ca pana te bhikkhū āgacchissanti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.16.eng: But now these monks are coming,

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.17.pli: Sohaṃ tehi ākiṇṇo na phāsu gamissāmi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.17.eng: and I won’t be at ease when they crowd me in.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.18.eng: Let me leave before they arrive.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.19.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato soreyyā saṅkassaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.19.eng: And he went from Soreyya to Saṅkassa.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.20.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū soreyyaṃ gantvā pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.20.eng: When the senior monks came to Soreyya

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.23.eng: that he had gone to Saṅkassa.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.24.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato saṅkassā kaṇṇakujjaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.24.eng: Revata then went from Saṅkassa to Kaṇṇakujja.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.25.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū saṅkassaṃ gantvā pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.25.eng: When the senior monks came to Saṅkassa

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.29.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato kaṇṇakujjā udumbaraṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.29.eng: Revata then went from Kaṇṇakujja to Udumbara.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.30.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū kaṇṇakujjaṃ gantvā pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.30.eng: When the senior monks came to Kaṇṇakujja

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.34.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato udumbarā aggaḷapuraṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.34.eng: Revata then went from Udumbara to Aggaḷapura.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.35.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū udumbaraṃ gantvā pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.35.eng: When the senior monks came to Udumbara

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.39.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato aggaḷapurā sahajātiṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.39.eng: Revata then went from Aggaḷapura to Sahajāti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.40.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū aggaḷapuraṃ gantvā pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.40.eng: When the senior monks came to Aggaḷapura

pli-tv-kd22:1.9.44.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ revataṃ sahajātiyaṃ sambhāvesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:1.9.44.eng: Finally the senior monks caught up with Revata at Sahajāti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī āyasmantaṃ yasaṃ kākaṇḍakaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.1.eng: Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī then said to Yasa,

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.2.pli: “ayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmā revato bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.2.eng: “Revata is learned and a master of the tradition; he’s an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he’s knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.3.pli: Sace mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ revataṃ pañhaṃ pucchissāma, paṭibalo āyasmā revato ekeneva pañhena sakalampi rattiṃ vītināmetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.3.eng: If we ask Revata a question, he would be capable of spending the whole night answering just that one.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.4.pli: Idāni ca panāyasmā revato antevāsikaṃ sarabhāṇakaṃ bhikkhuṃ ajjhesissati.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.4.eng: Now, soon he will ask a pupil monk to chant.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.5.pli: So tvaṃ tassa bhikkhuno sarabhaññapariyosāne āyasmantaṃ revataṃ upasaṅkamitvā imāni dasa vatthūni puccheyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.5.eng: Once the chanting is finished, go up to Revata and ask him about these ten practices.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto āyasmato sambhūtassa sāṇavāsissa paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato antevāsikaṃ sarabhāṇakaṃ bhikkhuṃ ajjhesi.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto tassa bhikkhuno sarabhaññapariyosāne yenāyasmā revato tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ revataṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.8.eng: Soon afterwards, when the chanting was finished, Yasa went up to Revata, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.9.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā yaso kākaṇḍakaputto āyasmantaṃ revataṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.12.eng: “Is it allowable to carry salt in a horn

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.13.eng: and then eat it whenever the food is unsalted?”
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.13.comm: Sp-ṭ 1.0: Siṅgena loṇaṁ pariharitvā pariharitvā aloṇakapiṇḍapātena saddhiṁ bhuñjituṁ kappati, na sannidhiṁ karotīti adhippāyo, “Carrying salt in a horn here and there, is it allowable to eat it together with unsalted almsfood? The meaning is one should not store it.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.15.eng: “Is the two-fingerbreadths practice allowable?”—“What’s the two fingerbreadths practice?”—“Is it allowable to eat at the wrong time, so long as the shadow of the sundial is within two fingerbreadths of midday?”—“No.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.17.pli: “Kappati, bhante, dvaṅgulāya chāyāya vītivattāya, vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjitun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.19.eng: “Is the next-village practice allowable?”—“What’s the next-village practice?”—“When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to eat non-leftover food if you intend to go to the next village?”—“No.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.21.pli: “Kappati, bhante—idāni gāmantaraṃ gamissāmīti—bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjitun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.23.eng: “Is the many-monasteries practice allowable?”—“What’s the many-monasteries practice?”—“When there are a number of monasteries within the same monastery zone, is it allowable for them to do the observance-day ceremony separately?”—“No.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.25.pli: “Kappati, bhante, sambahulā āvāsā samānasīmā nānuposathaṃ kātun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.27.eng: “Is the consent practice allowable?”—“What’s the consent practice?”—“Is it allowable to do a legal procedure with an incomplete Sangha, with the intention of getting consent from the absent monks afterwards?”—“No.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.32.eng: “Are customary practices allowable?”—“What are customary practices?”—“Is it allowable to follow the practices of one’s preceptors or teachers?”—“Sometimes it is, sometimes it isn’t.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.34.pli: “Kappati, bhante, idaṃ me upajjhāyena ajjhāciṇṇaṃ, idaṃ me ācariyena ajjhāciṇṇaṃ, taṃ ajjhācaritun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.35.pli: “Āciṇṇakappo kho, āvuso, ekacco kappati, ekacco na kappatī”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.36.eng: “Is the unchurned practice allowable?”—“What’s the unchurned practice?”—“When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to drink that which is halfway between milk and curd, if it’s not left over?”—“No.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.38.pli: “Kappati, bhante, yaṃ taṃ khīraṃ khīrabhāvaṃ vijahitaṃ, asampattaṃ dadhibhāvaṃ, taṃ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ pātun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.40.eng: “Is palm-juice drinking allowable?”—“What’s palm juice?”—“Is it allowable to drink that which has started to ferment, but which hasn’t yet become a proper alcoholic drink?”—“No.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.42.pli: “Kappati, bhante, yā sā surā āsutā, asampattā majjabhāvaṃ, sā pātun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.48.pli: “Ime, bhante, vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū vesāliyaṃ imāni dasa vatthūni dīpenti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.48.eng: “The Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaim these ten practices.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.49.pli: Handa mayaṃ, bhante, imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ādiyissāma.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.49.eng: Venerable, let’s take on this legal issue—

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.50.eng: before what’s contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.51.eng: before what’s contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.52.pli: pure adhammavādino balavanto honti, dhammavādino dubbalā honti;
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.52.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.53.pli: avinayavādino balavanto honti, vinayavādino dubbalā hontī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.53.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.54.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā revato āyasmato yasassa kākaṇḍakaputtassa paccassosi.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.54.eng: Saying, “Yes,” he consented to Yasa’s request.

pli-tv-kd22:1.10.55.eng: The first section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.1.eng: The Vajjian monks of Vesālī heard:

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.2.pli: “yaso kira kākaṇḍakaputto idaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ādiyitukāmo pakkhaṃ pariyesati, labhati ca kira pakkhan”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.2.eng: “It seems Yasa wants to take on this legal issue and is looking for supporters. And it seems he is gaining support.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.3.pli: Atha kho vesālikānaṃ vajjiputtakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.4.eng: “This legal issue is going to be contentious and difficult.

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.5.pli: Kaṃ nu kho mayaṃ pakkhaṃ labheyyāma, yena mayaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe balavantatarā assāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.5.eng: How can we get supporters to strengthen our side?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.6.pli: Atha kho vesālikānaṃ vajjiputtakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.7.pli: “ayaṃ kho āyasmā revato bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.7.eng: “Venerable Revata is learned and a master of the tradition; he’s an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he’s knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.8.pli: Sace mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ revataṃ pakkhaṃ labheyyāma, evaṃ mayaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe balavantatarā assāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.8.eng: If we get Revata to support us, we’ll be stronger.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.9.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū pahūtaṃ sāmaṇakaṃ parikkhāraṃ paṭiyādesuṃ—

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.10.pli: pattampi, cīvarampi, nisīdanampi, sūcigharampi, kāyabandhanampi, parissāvanampi, dhammakaraṇampi.
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.10.eng: a bowl, a robe, a sitting mat, a needle case, a belt, a water filter, and a water strainer.

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.11.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū taṃ sāmaṇakaṃ parikkhāraṃ ādāya nāvāya sahajātiṃ ujjaviṃsu;
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.11.eng: Taking those requisites, they traveled by boat upstream to Sahajāti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.1.12.pli: nāvāya paccorohitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle bhattavissaggaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.1.12.eng: After disembarking, they had a meal at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sāḷhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.1.eng: At this time, Venerable Sāḷha was reflecting in private:

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.2.eng: “Who speak in accordance with the Teaching—

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.3.eng: the monks from the east or the monks from Pāvā?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sāḷhassa, dhammañca vinayañca cetasā paccavekkhantassa, etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.4.eng: Reflecting on the Teaching and the Monastic Law, it occurred to him,

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.5.eng: “The monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.6.pli: Atha kho aññatarā suddhāvāsakāyikā devatā āyasmato sāḷhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya—
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.6.eng: Just then a god from the pure abodes read Sāḷha’s mind.

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.7.pli: seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—suddhāvāsesu devesu antarahitā āyasmato sāḷhassa sammukhe pāturahosi.
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.7.eng: Then, just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm, he disappeared from pure abodes and appeared in front of Sāḷha.

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.8.pli: Atha kho sā devatā āyasmantaṃ sāḷhaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.9.pli: “sādhu, bhante sāḷha, adhammavādī pācīnakā bhikkhū, dhammavādī pāveyyakā bhikkhū.
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.9.eng: “You’re right, Venerable Sāḷha. The monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.10.pli: Tena hi, bhante sāḷha, yathādhammo tathā tiṭṭhāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.10.eng: So then, take a stand in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.11.pli: “Pubbepi cāhaṃ, devate, etarahi ca yathādhammo tathā ṭhito;
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.11.eng: “I’ve always taken a stand in accordance with the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd22:2.2.12.pli: api cāhaṃ na tāva diṭṭhiṃ āvi karomi, appeva nāma maṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe sammanneyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.2.12.eng: But I won’t reveal my view in case I’m appointed to deal with this legal issue.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.1.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū taṃ sāmaṇakaṃ parikkhāraṃ ādāya yenāyasmā revato tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ revataṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.1.eng: The Vajjian monks then went to Revata and said,

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.3.pli: pattampi, cīvarampi, nisīdanampi, sūcigharampi, kāyabandhanampi, parissāvanampi, dhammakaraṇampī”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.4.pli: “Alaṃ, āvuso, paripuṇṇaṃ me pattacīvaran”ti na icchi paṭiggahetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.4.eng: Not wanting to accept them, he replied, “There’s no need. My bowl and robes are complete.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uttaro nāma bhikkhu vīsativasso āyasmato revatassa upaṭṭhāko hoti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.5.eng: At this time a monk called Uttara, who had twenty years of seniority, was Revata’s attendant.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.6.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū yenāyasmā uttaro tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ uttaraṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.6.eng: The Vajjian monks then went to him and said,

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.8.pli: pattampi, cīvarampi, nisīdanampi, sūcigharampi, kāyabandhanampi, parissāvanampi, dhammakaraṇampī”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.9.pli: “Alaṃ, āvuso, paripuṇṇaṃ me pattacīvaran”ti na icchi paṭiggahetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.9.eng: Not wanting to accept them, he replied, “There’s no need. My bowl and robes are complete.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.10.pli: “Manussā kho, āvuso uttara, bhagavato sāmaṇakaṃ parikkhāraṃ upanāmenti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.10.eng: “But people brought monastic requisites to the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.11.pli: Sace bhagavā paṭiggaṇhāti, teneva te attamanā honti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.11.eng: If the Buddha received them, they were pleased.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.12.pli: No ce bhagavā paṭiggaṇhāti, āyasmato ānandassa upanāmenti—
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.12.eng: If he didn’t, they brought them to Venerable Ānanda instead,

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.13.eng: saying, ‘Venerable, please accept these monastic requisites.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.14.pli: Yathā bhagavatā paṭiggahito, evameva so bhavissatīti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.14.eng: It’ll be as if they were received by the Buddha himself.’

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.15.eng: So please accept these monastic requisites.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.16.pli: Yathā therena paṭiggahito, evameva so bhavissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.16.eng: It’ll be as if they were received by the elder himself.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.17.pli: Atha kho āyasmā uttaro vesālikehi vajjiputtehi bhikkhūhi nippīḷiyamāno ekaṃ cīvaraṃ aggahesi.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.17.eng: Because he was pressured, Uttara received a robe.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.18.eng: And he said, “Please say what you want.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.20.eng: ‘Sir, please say this in the midst of the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.22.pli: Dhammavādī pācīnakā bhikkhū, adhammavādī pāveyyakā bhikkhū’”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.22.eng: The monks from the east speak in accordance with the Teaching, not so the monks from Pāvā.”’”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.24.pli: kho āyasmā uttaro vesālikānaṃ vajjiputtakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭissutvā yenāyasmā revato tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ revataṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.25.eng: and told him what he had been asked to say.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.27.pli: Dhammavādī pācīnakā bhikkhū, adhammavādī pāveyyakā bhikkhū’”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.28.pli: “Adhamme maṃ tvaṃ, bhikkhu, niyojesī”ti thero āyasmantaṃ uttaraṃ paṇāmesi.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.28.eng: Revata replied, “You’re urging me to act contrary to the Teaching,” and he dismissed Uttara.

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.29.pli: Atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ uttaraṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.29.eng: Soon afterwards the Vajjian monks asked Uttara,

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.32.pli: ‘Adhamme maṃ tvaṃ, bhikkhu, niyojesī’ti thero maṃ paṇāmesī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.32.eng: Saying, ‘You’re urging me to act contrary to the Teaching’, the elder dismissed me.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.33.eng: “But aren’t you a senior monk of twenty years’ standing?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.3.34.eng: “Yes. Nevertheless, I live with formal support from him because I respect him.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.34.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.454: Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāmāti kiñcāpi mayaṁ mahallakā, etaṁ pana theraṁ garuṁ katvā vasissāmāti adhippāyo, “Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāma: although I am a senior monk, I will dwell respecting this senior monk.” Vmv 4.454 adds: Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāmāti nissayamuttāpi mayaṁ ekaṁ sambhāvanīyagaruṁ nissayabhūtaṁ gahetvāva vasissāmāti adhippāyo, “Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāma: even though I no longer need support, I will live supported by one who is to be respected.” For an explanation of the rendering “formal support” for nissaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vinicchinitukāmo sannipati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.1.eng: The Sangha then gathered to make a decision on that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.3.eng: “Please, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.4.pli: Sace mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ idha vūpasamessāma, siyāpi mūlādāyakā bhikkhū punakammāya ukkoṭeyyuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.4.eng: If we were to resolve this legal issue here, it might be that the monks who started the ten practices would reopen it.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.4.comm: Vmv 4.455 explains mūlādāyakā as follows: Mūlādāyakāti paṭhamaṁ dasavatthūnaṁ dāyakā, “Mūlādāyakā means those who first gave the ten practices.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, yatthevimaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ samuppannaṃ, saṅgho tatthevimaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, the Sangha should resolve this legal issue in the place where it arose.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.6.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū vesāliṃ agamaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.6.eng: The senior monks then went to Vesālī

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.7.eng: to make a decision on that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sabbakāmī nāma pathabyā saṅghatthero vīsavassasatiko upasampadāya, āyasmato ānandassa saddhivihāriko, vesāliyaṃ paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.8.eng: At that time there was a monk called Sabbakāmī who had been ordained for one hundred and twenty years and was the most senior monk in the world. He had been a student of Venerable Ānanda and was now staying at Vesālī.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato āyasmantaṃ sambhūtaṃ sāṇavāsiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.10.pli: “ahaṃ, āvuso, yasmiṃ vihāre sabbakāmī thero viharati, taṃ vihāraṃ upagacchāmi.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.11.pli: So tvaṃ kālasseva āyasmantaṃ sabbakāmiṃ upasaṅkamitvā imāni dasa vatthūni puccheyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.11.eng: Please go to Sabbakāmī at the appropriate time and ask about these ten practices.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.12.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī āyasmato revatassa paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato, yasmiṃ vihāre sabbakāmī thero viharati, taṃ vihāraṃ upagacchi.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.14.pli: Gabbhe āyasmato sabbakāmissa senāsanaṃ paññattaṃ hoti, gabbhappamukhe āyasmato revatassa.
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.14.eng: Sabbakāmī had his resting place prepared in the room, whereas Revata had his prepared in the entryway.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.16.eng: that the old monk did not lie down,

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.17.eng: he too did not lie down.

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.19.eng: that the tired monk who had just arrived did not lie down,

pli-tv-kd22:2.4.20.eng: he too did not lie down.

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sabbakāmī rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṃ revataṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.1.eng: Getting up early in the morning, Sabbakāmī said to Revata,

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.2.pli: “katamena tvaṃ bhūmi vihārena etarahi bahulaṃ viharasī”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.3.pli: “Mettāvihārena kho ahaṃ, bhante, etarahi bahulaṃ viharāmī”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.4.pli: “Kullakavihārena kira tvaṃ bhūmi etarahi bahulaṃ viharasi.

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.5.eng: for good will is a noble meditation.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.5.comm: Sp 4.455: Kullakavihārenāti uttānavihārena, “Kullakavihāra means a straightforward meditation.” This, however, seems like a put-down, which does not fit the context well. It seems more likely to me that kullaka is instead related to Sanskrit kulya, “of a good/noble family”.

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.6.eng: “In the past, too, when I was a householder, I habitually practiced good will,

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.7.pli: Tenāhaṃ etarahipi mettāvihārena bahulaṃ viharāmi, api ca mayā cirappattaṃ arahattanti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.7.eng: and now it’s my main meditation. Besides, I attained perfection long ago.

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.8.pli: Thero pana, bhante, katamena vihārena etarahi bahulaṃ viharatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.8.eng: But what’s your main meditation, sir?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.9.pli: “Suññatāvihārena kho ahaṃ bhūmi etarahi bahulaṃ viharāmī”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.10.pli: “Mahāpurisavihārena kira, bhante, thero etarahi bahulaṃ viharati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.10.eng: “Your meditation is that of a great man,

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.11.eng: for emptiness is the meditation of a great man.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.12.eng: “In the past, too, when I was a householder, I habitually practiced emptiness,

pli-tv-kd22:2.5.13.pli: Tenāhaṃ etarahipi suññatāvihārena bahulaṃ viharāmi, api ca mayā cirappattaṃ arahattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.13.eng: and now it’s my main meditation. Besides, I attained perfection long ago.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.1.pli: Ayañcarahi therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ antarākathā vippakatā, athāyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī tasmiṃ anuppatto hoti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.1.eng: At that moment the conversation between the senior monks was interrupted because Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī arrived.

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī yenāyasmā sabbakāmī tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sabbakāmiṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.2.eng: Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī went up to Sabbakāmī, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sambhūto sāṇavāsī āyasmantaṃ sabbakāmiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.4.pli: “ime, bhante, vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū vesāliyaṃ dasa vatthūni dīpenti—
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.4.eng: “Sir, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaim ten practices as allowable:

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.5.pli: kappati siṅgiloṇakappo, kappati dvaṅgulakappo, kappati gāmantarakappo, kappati āvāsakappo, kappati anumatikappo, kappati āciṇṇakappo, kappati amathitakappo, kappati jaḷogiṃ, pātuṃ kappati adasakaṃ nisīdanaṃ, kappati jātarūparajatanti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.5.eng: the salt-in-horn practice; the two-fingerbreadths practice; the next-village practice; the many-monasteries practice; the consent practice; customary practices; the unchurned practice; palm-juice drinking; sitting mats without borders; and gold, silver, and money.

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.6.pli: Therena, bhante, upajjhāyassa mūle bahudhammo ca vinayo ca pariyatto.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.6.eng: Now, you’ve learned much at the feet of your preceptor, both of the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.7.pli: Therassa, bhante, dhammañca vinayañca paccavekkhantassa kathaṃ hoti?
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.7.eng: When you reflect on the Teaching and the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.8.eng: who speak in accordance with the Teaching—

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.9.eng: the monks from the east or the monks from Pāvā?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.10.pli: “Tayāpi kho, āvuso, upajjhāyassa mūle bahu dhammo ca vinayo ca pariyatto.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.10.eng: “You too have learned much at the feet of your preceptor, both of the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.11.pli: Tuyhaṃ pana, āvuso, dhammañca vinayañca paccavekkhantassa kathaṃ hoti?
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.11.eng: When you reflect on the Teaching and the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.12.eng: who speak in accordance with the Teaching—

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.13.eng: the monks from the east or the monks from Pāvā?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.14.pli: “Mayhaṃ kho, bhante, dhammañca vinayañca paccavekkhantassa evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.14.eng: “When I reflect like this, it occurs to me

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.15.pli: adhammavādī pācīnakā bhikkhū, dhammavādī pāveyyakā bhikkhūti;
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.15.eng: that the monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.16.pli: api cāhaṃ na tāva diṭṭhiṃ āvi karomi, appeva nāma maṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe sammanneyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.16.eng: But I won’t reveal my view in case I’m appointed to deal with this legal issue.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.17.pli: “Mayhampi kho, āvuso, dhammañca vinayañca paccavekkhantassa evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.17.eng: “And when I reflect like this, it occurs to me too

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.18.pli: adhammavādī pācīnakā bhikkhū, dhammavādī pāveyyakā bhikkhūti;
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.18.eng: that the monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.

pli-tv-kd22:2.6.19.pli: api cāhaṃ na tāva diṭṭhiṃ āvi karomi, appeva nāma maṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe sammanneyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.6.19.eng: And I too won’t reveal my view in case I’m appointed to deal with this legal issue.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vinicchinitukāmo sannipati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.1.eng: The Sangha then gathered to make a decision on that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.2.pli: Tasmiṃ kho pana adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anaggāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.2.eng: While they were discussing that legal issue, there was endless talk but not a single statement that could be understood.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.4.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.5.pli: Amhākaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anaggāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.5.eng: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk but not a single statement that could be understood.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.5.comm: I read anantāni with Kd 14:14.19.1 instead of anaggāni here.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ubbāhikāya vūpasameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.7.pli: Saṅgho cattāro pācīnake bhikkhū, cattāro pāveyyake bhikkhū uccini.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.7.eng: The Sangha then selected four monks from the east—

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.9.pli: āyasmantañca sabbakāmiṃ, āyasmantañca sāḷhaṃ, āyasmantañca khujjasobhitaṃ, āyasmantañca vāsabhagāmikaṃ;
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.9.eng: Venerable Sabbakāmī, Venerable Sāḷha, Venerable Khujjasobhita, and Venerable Vāsabhagāmika—

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.11.pli: āyasmantañca revataṃ, āyasmantañca sambhūtaṃ sāṇavāsiṃ, āyasmantañca yasaṃ kākaṇḍakaputtaṃ, āyasmantañca sumananti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.11.eng: Venerable Revata, Venerable Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī, Venerable Yasa of Kākaṇḍa, and Venerable Sumana.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.12.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.13.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.14.pli: Amhākaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anaggāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.14.eng: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk but not a single statement that could be understood.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.15.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho cattāro pācīnake bhikkhū, cattāro pāveyyake bhikkhū sammanneyya ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.15.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.17.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.18.pli: Amhākaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anaggāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.18.eng: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk but not a single statement that could be understood.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.19.pli: Saṅgho cattāro pācīnake bhikkhū, cattāro pāveyyake bhikkhū sammannati ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.19.eng: The Sangha appoints four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati catunnaṃ pācīnakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, catunnaṃ pāveyyakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sammuti, ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.20.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.22.pli: Sammatā saṅghena cattāro pācīnakā bhikkhū, cattāro pāveyyakā bhikkhū, ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.22.eng: The Sangha has appointed four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.23.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.24.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ajito nāma bhikkhu dasavasso saṅghassa pātimokkhuddesako hoti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.24.eng: At that time there was a monk called Ajita who had ten years of seniority and was the Sangha’s reciter of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.25.pli: Atha kho saṅgho āyasmantampi ajitaṃ sammannati—

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.26.eng: to assign seats to the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.28.pli: “kattha nu kho mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyāmā”ti?
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.28.eng: “Where should we resolve this legal issue?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.30.eng: “There’s the Vālika Monastery, which is delightful, quiet, and free from chatter.

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.31.pli: Yannūna mayaṃ vālikārāme imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.31.eng: Let’s resolve this legal issue there.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.32.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū vālikārāmaṃ agamaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.32.eng: And so they went to the Vālika Monastery.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.0.eng: The committee decides on the ten practices

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.2.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ sabbakāmiṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will question Venerable Sabbakāmī on the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.5.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ revatena vinayaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will reply when asked by Revata about the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato āyasmantaṃ sabbakāmiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.10.eng: “Is it allowable to carry salt in a horn

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.11.eng: and then eat it whenever the food is unsalted?”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.14.eng: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.16.eng: “An offense entailing confession for eating what has been stored.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.17.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.18.eng: The Sangha has decided on the first practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.19.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.20.eng: I make a note of this first decision.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.20.comm: Literally, “This is the first voting ticket that I place.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.21.eng: “Is the two-fingerbreadths practice allowable?”—“What’s the two-fingerbreadths practice?”—“Is it allowable to eat at the wrong time, so long as the shadow of the sundial is within two fingerbreadths of midday?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Rājagaha, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”—“What was committed?”—“An offense entailing confession for eating at the wrong time.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.21.comm: “Is it allowable to eat at the wrong time, so long as the shadow of the sundial is within two fingerbreadths of midday?” renders kappati, bhante, dvaṅgulāya chāyāya vītivattāya vikāle bhojanaṁ bhuñjituni. More literally this might be rendered as follows: “When two fingerbreadths of shade have passed, is it allowable to eat at the wrong time?” I interpret this to mean within two fingerbreadths of midday.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.23.pli: “Kappati, bhante, dvaṅgulāya chāyāya vītivattāya vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjitun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.29.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.30.eng: The Sangha has decided on the second practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.31.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.32.eng: I make a note of this second decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.33.eng: “Is the next-village practice allowable?”—“What’s the next-village practice?”—“When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to eat non-leftover food if you intend to go to the next village?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”—“What was committed?”—“An offense entailing confession for eating what isn’t left over.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.35.pli: “Kappati, bhante—idāni gāmantaraṃ gamissāmīti—bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjitun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.41.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.42.eng: The Sangha has decided on the third practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.43.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.44.eng: I make a note of this third decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.45.eng: “Is the many-monasteries practice allowable?”—“What’s the many-monasteries practice?”—“When there are a number of monasteries within the same monastery zone, is it allowable to do the observance-day ceremony separately?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Rājagaha, in what’s connected to the observance-day ceremony.”—“What was committed?”—“An act of wrong conduct for going beyond the Monastic Law.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.45.comm: “What’s connected to the observance-day ceremony” renders uposathasaṁyutta, which is identified at Sp-ṭ 4.457 as the Uposathakkhandhaka, The Chapter on the Observance Day. But perhaps it is better regarded as a forerunner to the Uposathakkhandhaka.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.47.pli: “Kappati, bhante, sambahulā āvāsā samānasīmā nānuposathaṃ kātun”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.53.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.54.eng: The Sangha has decided on the fourth practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.55.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.56.eng: I make a note of this fourth decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.57.eng: “Is the consent practice allowable?”—“What’s the consent practice?”—“Is it allowable to do a legal procedure with an incomplete Sangha, with the intention of getting consent from the absent monks afterwards?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“In the section on Those from Campā, in the Monastic Law.”—“What was committed?”—“An act of wrong conduct for going beyond the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.66.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.67.eng: The Sangha has decided on the fifth practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.68.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.69.eng: I make a note of this fifth decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.70.eng: “Are customary practices allowable?”—“What are customary practices?”—“Is it allowable to follow the practices of one’s preceptors or teachers?”—“Sometimes it is, sometimes it isn’t.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.73.pli: idaṃ me upajjhāyena ajjhāciṇṇaṃ, idaṃ me ācariyena ajjhāciṇṇaṃ—

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.75.pli: “Āciṇṇakappo kho, āvuso, ekacco kappati, ekacco na kappatī”ti.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.76.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.77.eng: The Sangha has decided on the sixth practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.78.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.79.eng: I make a note of this sixth decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.80.eng: “Is the unchurned practice allowable?”—“What’s the unchurned practice?”—“When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to drink that which is halfway between milk and curd, if it isn’t leftover?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”—“What was committed?”—“An offense entailing confession for eating what isn’t left over.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.82.pli: “Kappati, bhante, yaṃ taṃ khīraṃ khīrabhāvaṃ vijahitaṃ, asampattaṃ dadhibhāvaṃ, taṃ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ pātun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.88.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.89.eng: The Sangha has decided on the seventh practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.90.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.91.eng: I make a note of this seventh decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.92.eng: “Is palm-juice drinking allowable?”—“What’s palm juice?”—“Is it allowable to drink that which has started to ferment, but which hasn’t yet become a proper alcoholic drink?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Kosambī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”—“What was committed?”—“An offense entailing confession for drinking alcohol.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.94.pli: “Kappati, bhante, yā sā surā āsutā asampattā majjabhāvaṃ, sā pātun”ti?

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.100.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.101.eng: The Sangha has decided on the eighth practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.102.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.103.eng: I make a note of this eighth decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.104.eng: “Are sitting mats without borders allowable?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”—“What was committed?”—“An offense entailing confession in relation to the rule concerning cutting.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.104.comm: “The rule concerning cutting” renders chedanake pācittiyaṁ. Sp 4.457: Chedanakasikkhāpade vuttapācittiyaṁ āpajjatīti attho, “The meaning is he commits the said offense entailing confession in the training rule on cutting.” This refers to Bu Pc 89.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.110.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.111.eng: The Sangha has decided on the ninth practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.112.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.113.eng: I make a note of this ninth decision.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.114.eng: “Is gold, silver, or money allowable?”—“No.”—“Where was it prohibited?”—“At Rājagaha, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”—“What was committed?”—“An offense entailing confession for receiving gold, silver, or money.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.120.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.121.eng: The Sangha has decided on the tenth practice.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.122.eng: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.123.eng: I make a note of this tenth decision.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.124.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.125.eng: The Sangha has decided on the ten practices.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.126.eng: These ten practices are contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.127.eng: “The legal issue has been resolved and properly disposed of.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.128.pli: Api ca maṃ tvaṃ, āvuso, saṅghamajjhepi imāni dasa vatthūni puccheyyāsi—tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ saññattiyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.128.eng: Nevertheless, for the purpose of convincing the other monks, you should ask me about these ten practices also in the midst of the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.129.pli: Atha kho āyasmā revato āyasmantaṃ sabbakāmiṃ saṅghamajjhepi imāni dasa vatthūni pucchi.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.129.eng: Revata then asked Sabbakāmī about the ten practices in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.130.eng: And Sabbakāmī was able to reply to each and every question.

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.1.pli: Imāya kho pana vinayasaṅgītiyā satta bhikkhusatāni anūnāni anadhikāni ahesuṃ, tasmāyaṃ vinayasaṅgīti “sattasatikā”ti vuccatīti.
pli-tv-kd22:2.9.1.eng: At this communal recitation of the Monastic Law there were seven hundred monks, neither more nor less. This is why this communal recitation is called “The group of seven hundred”.

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.2.pli: Sattasatikakkhandhako dvādasamo. Imamhi khandhake vatthū pañcavīsati.
pli-tv-kd22:2.9.2.eng: The twelfth chapter on the group of seven hundred is finished. In this chapter there are twenty-five topics.

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.5.eng: Legal procedure, he entered with a messenger;

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.10.comm: Reading the m as junction consonant.

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.12.eng: A bowl, went upstream with a boat,

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.16.eng: The chapter on the group of seven hundred is finished.

pli-tv-kd22:2.9.18.eng: The canonical text of the Small Division is finished.
